summary: This is an email from August 10, 2019, forwarding a report from Dr. Megarding regarding her last interaction with Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on Thursday, August 8, 2019. The report describes Epstein's demeanor, requests, and denial of suicidal thoughts shortly before his death.

events.title: Last Clinical Assessment of Epstein
events.description: Dr. Megarding visited Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York. Epstein denied any suicidal thoughts or mental health concerns, made various requests (e.g., move to general population, social calls without speaker phone), and was planning to meet with his attorneys.

keyFacts: On August 8, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was assessed by Dr. Megarding in the SHU at MCC New York and explicitly denied any suicidal thoughts or intention.
Epstein was reported to have a cell mate at the time of this assessment, contradicting later reports of him being alone before his death.
Epstein made specific requests during the assessment, including a transfer to general population and social calls without a speaker phone.
His mood was described as not depressed or anxious, with no signs of distress, and he was planning to meet with his attorneys.
This clinical assessment occurred just two days before Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
